citeinfo.title: Exploring the exceptional performance of a deep learning stream temperature model and the value of streamflow data: 3 Model inputs
Exploring the exceptional performance of a deep learning stream temperature model and the value of streamflow data.

descript.abstract: This data release component contains model inputs including river basin attributes, weather forcing data, and simulated and observed river discharge.
descript.purpose: Decision support, water quality research, and advancement of machine learning in hydrology

spdom.descgeog: Locations of sites used in the study, which are a subset of the GAGES-II dataset.

place.placekt: Department of Commerce, 1995, Countries, Dependencies, Areas of Special Sovereignty, and Their Principal Administrative Divisions, Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 10-4, Washington, D.C., National Institute of Standards and Technology

U.S. Department of Commerce, 1987, Codes for the identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the outlying areas of the United States, and associated areas (Federal Information Processing Standard 5-2): Washington, D. C., NIST

idinfo.useconst: None, but see "Distribution Liability"/"distliab" below. Users are advised to read the associated publication thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.
idinfo.datacred: This study was funded by the Integrated Water Prediction Program of the U.S. Geological Survey, including funds transfered to Pennsylvania State University via Pennsylvania Water Resources Research Center graduate internship G19AC00425.
idinfo.native: Archive-ready data were prepared for this release using the x86_64-apple-darwin17.0 operating system and the R statistical programming language (R version 4.0.2, 2020-06-22; R Core Team, 2020; https://www.R-project.org). R packages loaded into this environment: reticulate, version: 1.16; zip, version: 2.1.1; dssecrets, version: 0.1.4; sbtools, version: 1.1.12; sf, version: 0.9-6; rgdal, version: 1.5-18; sp, version: 1.4-4; feather, version: 0.3.5; meddle, version: 0.0.11; mapdata, version: 2.3.0; maps, version: 3.3.0; yaml, version: 2.2.1; scipiper, version: 0.0.23; forcats, version: 0.5.0; stringr, version: 1.4.0; dplyr, version: 1.0.2; purrr, version: 0.3.4; readr, version: 1.4.0; tidyr, version: 1.1.2; tibble, version: 3.0.4; ggplot2, version: 3.3.2; tidyverse, version: 1.3.0. Model-ready data used to train and run the models for the manuscript were originally procesed in the python programming language (Python version 3.7.9; Python Software Foundation, 2020; https://www.python.org). These python modules were installed: appdirs, v1.4.4; argon2-cffi, v20.1.0; attrs, v20.2.0; backcall, v0.2.0; basemap, v1.2.1; blas, v1.0; bleach, v3.2.1; ca-certificates, v2020.7.22; certifi, v2020.6.20; citeinfo.title: Enhancing streamflow forecast and extracting insights using long-short term memory networks with data integration at continental scales

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

citeinfo.title: National Water Information System data available on the World Wide Web (USGS Water Data for the Nation)
GAGES-II: Geospatial attributes of gages for evaluating streamflow
Daymet: Daily Surface Weather Data on a 1-km Grid for North America, Version 3
Google Earth Engine: Planetary-scale geospatial analysis for everyone

procstep.procdesc: Discharge data at the 118 selected USGS monitoring sites were retrieved from the USGS National Water Information System (NWIS; U.S. Geological Survey, 2020) using the HTTPS and the NWIS web applications programming interface. Attribute data for the basins contributing to those 118 USGS monitoring sites were downloaded from the GAGES-II database (Falcone 2011). Basin-averaged daily meteorological forcing data (precipitation, maximum and minimum air temperature, vapor pressure, solar radiation) were obtained by interpolating a gridded meteorological dataset (Daymet) (Thornton et al. 2016) from Google Earth Engine (GEE) (Gorelick et al. 2017). Although some of these datasets were initially downloaded to cover longer periods of time, we subset the results to the combined training and test period for this study, 2010-10-01 through 2016-09-30, for the analysis by Rahmani et al. (2020) and this data release.

enttyp.enttypd: Daily weather driver data that were used as inputs to the temperature models.

attr.attrdef: Unique USGS site identifier.
Duration of the daylight period in seconds per day. This calculation is based on the period of the day during which the sun is above a hypothetical flat horizon.
attr.attrdefs: dayl as in Thornton et al. 2016

attr.attrdef: Daily total precipitation in millimeters per day, sum of all forms converted to water-equivalent. Precipitation occurrence on any given day may be ascertained.
attr.attrdefs: prcp as in Thornton et al. 2016

attr.attrdef: Incident shortwave radiation flux density in watts per square meter, taken as an average over the daylight period of the day. NOTE: Daily total radiation (MJ/m2/day) can be calculated as follows: ((srad (W/m2) * dayl (s/day)) / l,000,000).
attr.attrdefs: srad as in Thornton et al. 2016

attr.attrdef: Snow water equivalent in kilograms per square meter. The amount of water contained within the snowpack.
attr.attrdefs: swe as in Thornton et al. 2016

attr.attrdef: Daily maximum 2-meter air temperature in degrees Celsius.
attr.attrdefs: tmax as in Thornton et al. 2016

attr.attrdef: Daily minimum 2-meter air temperature in degrees Celsius.
attr.attrdefs: tmin as in Thornton et al. 2016

attr.attrdef: Water vapor pressure in pascals. Daily average partial pressure of water vapor.
attr.attrdefs: vp as in Thornton et al. 2016

attr.attrdef: Date of observation

enttyp.enttypd: River basin characteristics used as inputs to the water temperature model.

attr.attrdef: Unique USGS site identifier.
Watershed drainage area.
Stream density (length of streams per area of watershed).
Dam storage in watershed per watershed area.
Watershed percent forest.
Watershed percent agriculture (plant).
Mean watershed slope.
Raw straight line distance of gage location to nearest major dam in watershed.
Dunne overland flow as percentage of total streamflow.
Raw straight line distance of gage location to nearest dam in watershed.
Raw average straight line distance of gage location to all major dams in watershed.
Average of minimum monthly air temperature for 1971-2000.
Standard deviation of minimum monthly air temperature for 1971-2000.
Watershed average relative humidity.
Raw average straight line distance of gage location to all dams in watershed.
Mean annual precipitation for watershed for 1971-2000.
Percent of watershed area covered by lake/pond/reservoir.
Average annual air temperature for the watershed.
Average of maximum monthly air temperature for 1971-2000.
Standard deviation of maximum monthly air temperature for 1971-2000.
Number of dams in watershed.
Mean watershed elevation.

enttyp.enttypd: Simulated discharge that was used as an input to the water temperature models. Simulated discharge was only used during the test period (water years 2014-2016).

attr.attrdef: Unique USGS site identifier.
Date of prediction.
Stream discharge as predicted by the discharge model.
attr.attrdefs: This study; Feng, Fang, and Shen 2020

enttyp.enttypd: Observed mean daily discharge for the 118 monitoring locations in this study. Discharge (flow) observations were used as a driver in the water temperature model.

attr.attrdef: Unique USGS site identifier.
Date of temperature observation.
Observed mean daily discharge

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.

digtinfo.formname: Comma-separated values (CSV; MIME Type text/csv), where weather_drivers.csv is compressed to zipfile (weather_drivers.zip)

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
